title: ARCHIVES: Live From the 2015 Hospital of Tomorrow Conference
text:
ARCHIVES: Live From the 2015 Hospital of Tomorrow Conference Couldn't make it to the conference? See webcasts from the keynote speeches and other sessions. "Maybe the hospital of the future is a network," Jonathan Bush, CEO of athenahealth, Inc., said during the U.S. News Hospital of Tomorrow conference.
By U.S. News Staff Oct. 20, 2015 | 4:02 p.m. EDT + More During U.S. News & World Report's third annual Hospital of Tomorrow conference, experts and industry leaders gathered in Washington Oct. 18-20 to discuss the challenges facing the hospital industry and share new thinking about the future of health care in the United States.
If you couldn't attend the conference, you can see what you missed via Twitter (#USNHOT15) or these archived webcasts.
Sunday, Oct. 18
Opening Keynote : The keynote session on Sunday, Oct. 18, featured John H. Noseworthy, M.D., president and CEO of the Mayo Clinic, who spoke about "The Face of High-Value Health Care: People and Processes."
An executive roundtable discussion, "Transforming Health Care: Strategies for Tomorrow," followed; participants included Noseworthy as well as Nancy M. Schlichting, CEO of Henry Ford Health System, and Warner L. Thomas, president and CEO, Ochsner Health System. Joanne Kenen, health care editor at Politico, moderated the discussion.
David N. Fisher, vice president, healthcare policy and strategy, Siemens Healthcare, and Kaveh Safavi, M.D., global managing director, health industry, Accenture, offered keynote remarks.
Monday, Oct. 19
Patient Engagement and Success : This case study, "Patient Engagement Is Critical to the Success of a Value-Based Health Care System," was sponsored by Zimmer Biomet.
Analytics and Patient Care : This case study, sponsored by Optum, discussed how " Analytics Transform Patient Care at Lehigh Valley Health Network."
Luncheon/keynote session : On Monday, Oct. 19, the keynote focused on "Connecting the Disconnect," with remarks by athenahealth's Jonathan Bush. It was followed by an executive roundtable on the topic of "The New Health Care Landscape."
Tech Data Collaboration : This case study, which focused on "Executing World-Class Industry and Technology Collaboration to Measurably Improve Health Care, Safety, Quality and Outcomes," was sponsored by Microsoft.
Successful Physician Networks : Sponsored by athenahealth, this case study looked at "Orchestrating a High Performing Physician Network in the Accountable Care Era."
Tuesday, Oct. 20
Closing Keynote : To close out the conference, this keynote featured Andy Slavitt, acting administrator at the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. His talk was followed by a keynote dialogue between Rep. Kevin Brady (R-Texas), chairman of the House Ways and Means Subcommittee on Health, and U.S. News & World Report Editor and Chief Content Officer Brian Kelly.
